message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.ST, cs.CV 

The paper introduces a data-driven technique for building density, regression, and classification models using a staged mixture modeling approach. This technique involves sequentially adding components to a finite mixture model using the structural expectation maximization (SEM) algorithm, which is commonly used in machine learning and statistics. The paper also shows that the approach is qualitatively similar to boosting, which is a popular machine learning technique for improving the performance of weak learners. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Additionally, since the paper involves experimental evaluation using real-world data, it may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.ST (Statistics) and cs.CV (Computer Vision).
